thread.title: Forgotten feast: John Newton on the abundance of Australia's native foods
thread.title_full: Forgotten feast: John Newton on the abundance of Australia's native foods

title: Forgotten feast: John Newton on the abundance of Australia's native foods
text:
Forgotten feast: John Newton on the abundance of Australia's native foods Share Download (21.14 MB) MP3 available 21.14 MB 
For decades John has been writing about food, and food cultures around the world, both as an author, and restaurant critic. 
He's now turned his attention to Australian native foods, those he calls 'the oldest foods on Earth'. 
These are the enormous number of edible plants and animals that supported human life for many thousands of years before colonisation. 
John says it makes no sense that we love 'superfoods' from remote, exotic locations, and ignore those growing right here. 
A stunning example of this is the Kakadu plum, the world's highest known source of Vitamin C. 
John wants to see Australian home cooks enjoying native ingredients, as we do the foods of so many other cultures. 
Further information 
The Oldest Foods on Earth A History of Australian Native Foods is published by NewSouth Books Duration: 46min 6sec Broadcast: Mon 6 Feb 2017, 11:00am Published: Wed 1 Feb 2017, 4:51pm Guests
